speaker: firstWitch
dialog: When shall we three meet again, in thunder, lightning, or in rain?

speaker: secondWitch
dialog: When the hurlyburly's done, When the battle's lost and won.

speaker: thirdWitch
dialog: That will be ere the set of sun.

speaker: duncan
dialog: What bloody man is that? He can report, As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt the newest state.

speaker: malcolm
dialog: This is the sergeant Who like a good and hardy soldier fought 'Gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend! Say to the king the knowledge of the broil As thou didst leave it.

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Doubtful it stood; As two spent swimmers, that do cling together And choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Worthy to be a rebel, for to that The multiplying villanies of nature Do swarm upon him--from the western isles

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied; And fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak: For brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--
